detaileddescription.para: Default for -blockmaxweight, which controls the range of block weights the mining code will create
Default for -blockreservedweight

This accounts for the block header, var_int encoding of the transaction count and a minimally viable coinbase transaction. It adds an additional safety margin, because even with a thorough understanding of block serialization, it's easy to make a costly mistake when trying to squeeze every last byte. Setting a lower value is prevented at startup.
Default for -blockmintxfee, which sets the minimum feerate for a transaction in blocks created by mining code
The maximum weight for transactions we're willing to relay/mine
The minimum non-witness size for transactions we're willing to relay/mine: one larger than 64
Maximum number of signature check operations in an IsStandard() P2SH script
The maximum number of sigops we're willing to relay/mine in a single tx
The maximum number of potentially executed legacy signature operations in a single standard tx
Default for -incrementalrelayfee, which sets the minimum feerate increase for mempool limiting or replacement
Default for -bytespersigop
Default for -permitbaremultisig
The maximum number of witness stack items in a standard P2WSH script
The maximum size in bytes of each witness stack item in a standard P2WSH script
The maximum size in bytes of each witness stack item in a standard BIP 342 script (Taproot, leaf version 0xc0)
The maximum size in bytes of a standard witnessScript
The maximum size of a standard ScriptSig

Min feerate for defining dust. Changing the dust limit changes which transactions are standard and should be done with care and ideally rarely. It makes sense to only increase the dust limit after prior releases were already not creating outputs below the new threshold
Default for -minrelaytxfee, minimum relay fee for transactions
Maximum number of transactions per cluster (default)
Maximum size of cluster in virtual kilobytes
Default for -limitancestorcount, max number of in-mempool ancestors
Default for -limitdescendantcount, max number of in-mempool descendants
Default for -datacarrier
Default setting for -datacarriersize in vbytes.

An extra transaction can be added to a package, as long as it only has one ancestor and is no larger than this. Not really any reason to make this configurable as it doesn't materially change DoS parameters.
Maximum number of ephemeral dust outputs allowed.

memberdef.name: MANDATORY_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS
memberdef.initializer: {SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH | SCRIPT_VERIFY_DERSIG | SCRIPT_VERIFY_NULLDUMMY | SCRIPT_VERIFY_CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY | SCRIPT_VERIFY_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY | SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS | SCRIPT_VERIFY_TAPROOT}

detaileddescription.para: Mandatory script verification flags that all new transactions must comply with for them to be valid. Failing one of these tests may trigger a DoS ban; see CheckInputScripts() for details.
Note that this does not affect consensus validity; see GetBlockScriptFlags() for that.

memberdef.name: STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS
memberdef.initializer: {MANDATORY_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS | SCRIPT_VERIFY_STRICTENC | SCRIPT_VERIFY_MINIMALDATA | SCRIPT_VERIFY_DISCOURAGE_UPGRADABLE_NOPS | SCRIPT_VERIFY_CLEANSTACK | SCRIPT_VERIFY_MINIMALIF | SCRIPT_VERIFY_NULLFAIL | SCRIPT_VERIFY_LOW_S | SCRIPT_VERIFY_DISCOURAGE_UPGRADABLE_WITNESS_PROGRAM | SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS_PUBKEYTYPE | SCRIPT_VERIFY_CONST_SCRIPTCODE | SCRIPT_VERIFY_DISCOURAGE_UPGRADABLE_TAPROOT_VERSION | SCRIPT_VERIFY_DISCOURAGE_OP_SUCCESS | SCRIPT_VERIFY_DISCOURAGE_UPGRADABLE_PUBKEYTYPE}

detaileddescription.para: Standard script verification flags that standard transactions will comply with. However we do not ban/disconnect nodes that forward txs violating the additional (non-mandatory) rules here, to improve forwards and backwards compatibility.
For convenience, standard but not mandatory verify flags.
Used as the flags parameter to sequence and nLocktime checks in non-consensus code.
Get the vout index numbers of all dust outputs

memberdef.argsstring: (const CTransaction &tx, const std::optional< unsigned > &max_datacarrier_bytes, bool permit_bare_multisig, const CFeeRate &dust_relay_fee, std::string &reason)
memberdef.name: IsStandardTx

detaileddescription.para:
Check for standard transaction types
True if all outputs (scriptPubKeys) use only standard transaction forms

Check for standard transaction types
mapInputs
Map of previous transactions that have outputs we're spending
True if all inputs (scriptSigs) use only standard transaction forms
Check transaction inputs.

This does three things:
Prevents mempool acceptance of spends of future segwit versions we don't know how to validate
Mitigates a potential denial-of-service attack with P2SH scripts with a crazy number of expensive CHECKSIG/CHECKMULTISIG operations.
Prevents spends of unknown/irregular scriptPubKeys, which mitigates potential denial-of-service attacks involving expensive scripts and helps reserve them as potential new upgrade hooks.
Note that only the non-witness portion of the transaction is checked here.
We also check the total number of non-witness sigops across the whole transaction, as per BIP54.

Check if the transaction is over standard P2WSH resources limit: 3600bytes witnessScript size, 80bytes per witness stack element, 100 witness stack elements These limits are adequate for multisignatures up to n-of-100 using OP_CHECKSIG, OP_ADD, and OP_EQUAL.
Also enforce a maximum stack item size limit and no annexes for tapscript spends.
Check whether this transaction spends any witness program but P2A, including not-yet-defined ones. May return false early for consensus-invalid transactions.

memberdef.argsstring: (int64_t nWeight, int64_t nSigOpCost, unsigned int bytes_per_sigop)
